notEnoughChars: You must enter at least @chars characters!
ariaNavigatedToSolution: Navigated to newly included sample solution after textarea.
ariaShowSolution: Show the solution. You will be provided with a sample solution.

taskDescription:
The following data for isomeric four-carbon alcohols show that there is a decrease in boiling point with increasing substitution of the OH-bearing carbon. How might you account for this trend?

  • 1-Butanol, bp 117.5 °C
  • 2-Butanol, bp 99.5 °C
  • 2-Methyl-2-propanol, bp 82.2 °C
detailedSolution: Hydrogen-bonding is more difficult in hindered alcohols.
